intro: Cryptandra connata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed cryptandra, is a shrub native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, often glandular leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its seeds are enclosed in small, woody capsules that split open to release the seeds. Cryptandra connata is typically found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
